title: Naoki Sakai (footballer)
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Sakai was born in <a href="Nagareyama">Nagareyama</a> on August 2, 1975. He joined his local club <a href="Kashiwa%20Reysol">Kashiwa Reysol</a> from youth team in 1994. He played as right midfielder. The club won the champions at <a href="1999%20J.League%20Cup">1999 J.League Cup</a>. From 2000, his opportunity to play decreased behind <a href="Mitsuteru%20Watanabe">Mitsuteru Watanabe</a>. He moved to <a href="Hokkaido%20Consadole%20Sapporo">Consadole Sapporo</a> in 2002. He retired end of 2003 season.
National team career.
On October 13, 1996, Sakai debuted for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> against <a href="Tunisia%20national%20football%20team">Tunisia</a>.
